intro: Astragalus darii, commonly known as the Darii milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to thrive in poor soils and withstand drought. Astragalus darii is also valued for its potential medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
